WorkItem.Description: In a simple 3 node graph described in the attached gml file, the disconnected node ends up laying out on top of another node.
WorkItem.Summary: Efficient Sugiyama laying out individual nodes on-top of one another

Comments.Message:
As a bit of an update, there is a way (albeit, not a very pretty way) of working around this:

1.  Create a custom vertex type and custom connection type Hidden
2.  create custom control templates that are invisible for both of those types.
3.  Create a single false "root" that then has hidden edges connected to all the other roots
